titles.title: Waiving certain points of order against the bill (H.R. 2520) making appropriations for the Department of the Interior and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1994, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-163, by Mr. Gordon.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2520. Waiving all points of order against consideration of the bill. During consideration of the bill all points of order against provisions specified in the text of this resolution for failure to comply with clause 2 or 6 of rule XXI shall be waived. Where points of order are waived against a part of a paragraph, a point of order against the balance of the paragraph may apply only to the balance of the paragraph and not against the entire paragraph.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 62.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/29/1993--Introduced. Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 2520 (FY 1994 appropriations for the Department of the Interior and related agencies).
